meanings.definition: Causing sudden surprise, fear, or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder was startling to the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected noise was quite startling for everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The startling sound made the cat jump in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The startling news hit her like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The startling image of the ghost in the movie stayed with her for days.

meanings.sent1: The sudden appearance of the clown was a startling moment for the children.
meanings.sent2: The startling of the audience was evident when the magician made the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent3: The startling of the teacher by the prankster student caused a ripple of laughter in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The startling of the news anchor by the breaking story was captured live on air.
meanings.sent5: The startling of the baby by the loud noise made him cry inconsolably.
